title: wishlist: enhance AnnexRepo.get_urls() to "mint" URLs for files under git, git annex special remotes etc

labels.name: severity-minor
labels.description: a problem which doesn't affect the package's usefulness, and is presumably trivial to fix

body:
ATM `get_urls` returns list of urls as known to git-annex.
  
"Information" about locations of files under git (e.g. as also available from other clones), or under special remotes, even if they are known to be exposed publicly or via ssh would is not used.  But potentially we can "mint" (create/compile/construct) ssh:// s3:// http*:// etc URLs based on the information contained in git/git-annex and local .git/config.  That would allow establishing a list of urls for possible downloads by external tools, such as perspective jsdownloader (see https://github.com/con/jsdownloader/issues/1).

I am not sure if anything like that could/should be implemented in git-annex (attn @joeyh, I could be wrong), that is why filing this wishlist issue here for further discussion.

PS I took `get_urls` as a possible location for (optional) feature, but it might be implemented as another method, and should be interfaced at the level of a Dataset, so it would be sufficient to query paths to subdatasets without needing to "manually" resolve to a particular one first.
